decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved. Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing dwelling to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The planning permission hereby approved would not obviate the need to obtain the appropriate approval under building control. You are also reminded that this approval would not discharge your duties with respect to other acts and regulations, including the 1984 Party Wall Act. The planning permission would not allow you to enter or trespass onto other land which does not belong to you unless the appropriate agreement and consent has been obtained.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent Mr Siraz Aswat with regards to removing the rear dormer from the proposed extension. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 04/05/2020.
description: Loft conversion with two rooflights and single storey rear extension with patio.
